intro: Neobuxbaumia scoparia, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its compact, globular shape and silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating drought tolerance and adaptability to poor soil conditions. Neobuxbaumia scoparia plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
